speaker: Tomb of Names
lines: The name you paint tastes like rain in winter.
It belongs to someone who taught you a word for mercy you could carry alone.
The stone warms in your palm as if it remembers a forehead.
When you set it in its gap, the shelf becomes entirely itself again.
A moth leaves the brush and flies in a circle that can't quite close.
You hear a thank-you where a draft used to be.
Your own name fits more comfortable in your mouth afterward.
The stairs up look less like a distance and more like a direction.

give_item.name: Token of Thanks
give_item.description: A pebble that feels like permission
